job_title: Medical Assistant in North Hills, CA
pros: Offers benefits and accepts people with no experience.
cons: Micromanage and a lot of miscommunication between them. Throws medical Assistant to assist providers with no training when short staffed. Pay is very low for the amount of work you do and when asking for a raise is never received.

review_title: Owner doesn’t care much about employees
job_title: Medical Assistant in North Hills, CA
pros: Opportunity to learn, hires recent graduates, fair management, good camaraderie between coworkers.
cons: No hopes of getting a pay raise until 2-3 years, a lot of work for little pay, schedules employees to work with providers they were never trained for, little to no training provided, unpredictable changes in schedule and location, favoritism, and doesn’t want to be flexible when employees has an appointment or event to attend. Owner does not care about patients since he hires providers who are not reliable, does not discipline providers for frequent absenteeism and patients end up switching to a different medical group also has some providers that are extremely rude to patients.

Nik Gupta is horrible and only cares about his 5ook salary and it’s suppose to be non profit.  If you say something bad you get fired…..

review_title: Is 1 Star really the lowest I can go?
cons: EVERYTHING. This is one of the worst places I have ever worked at in my 7 years out in practice. I’m so glad I’m no longer with them and it’s so unfortunate I even had to associate myself with this company. Unprofessional. Disrespectful. Unorganized. CEO is awful. Management is the worst. Actually more like there was no management. I would rather sit at home and do nothing than work for this terrible place.

pros: Diverse patient base culturally and from the disease management standpoint as well.
cons: Poor senior management is apparent in that it seems difficult to manage the gulf between the Medical Group and the Administrative Group.

pros: Good Coworkers and low pay for the employees
cons: Management wasn't really good in dealing with their workers and especially patients
